February 9, 1997: Fiction
HORNET'S NEST, by Patricia Cornwell. (Putnam, $25.95.) The experiences of
two policewomen and a reporter as they patrol the streets of Charlotte, N.C.
TOTAL CONTROL, by David Baldacci. (Warner, $25.) A woman's effort to find her
husband, who has disappeared, discloses many of big business's current ways.
AIRFRAME, by Michael Crichton. (Knopf, $26.) A young woman investigates a
near disaster that befell a plane on its way from Hong Kong to Denver.
THE CLINIC, by Jonathan Kellerman. (Bantam, $24.95.) Alex Delaware
investigates the murder of a woman who wrote a best-selling indictment of men.
DRUMS OF AUTUMN, by Diana Gabaldon. (Delacorte, $24.95.) The travails of a
Scottish couple cast ashore in North Carolina on the brink of the American
Revolution.
SILENT WITNESS, by Richard North Patterson. (Knopf, $25.95.) Two murder
cases change the lives of men and women who grew up in a Midwestern town.
THE NOTEBOOK, by Nicholas Sparks. (Warner, $16.95.) A World War II veteran
meets an old flame who is about to be married.
THE DEEP END OF THE OCEAN, by Jacquelyn Mitchard. (Viking, $23.95.) The
disappearance of a 3-year-old brings a family anguish and redemption.
THE CELESTINE PROPHECY, by James Redfield. (Warner, $17.95.) An ancient
manuscript, found in Peru, provides insights into achieving a fulfilling life.
ALIAS GRACE, by Margaret Atwood. (Talese/Doubleday, $24.95.) The enigmatic
life of a 19th-century woman who was convicted of a double murder when she was
BLOOD AND HONOR, by W. E. B. Griffin. (Putnam, $24.95.) In Buenos Aires in
1943, three Americans cope with German efforts to provide for a postwar Reich.
DEEP WATERS, by Jayne Ann Krentz. (Pocket, $23.) The crises encountered by
a corporate couple in the Northwest as they try to find romance and a murderer.
THE FALLEN MAN, by Tony Hillerman. (HarperCollins, $24.) Two Navajo
policemen investigate the mysterious death of a man atop a sacred mountain.
THE UNLIKELY SPY, by Daniel Silva. (Villard, $25.) An attractive widow and an
absent-minded professor play the roles of spy and counterspy in London during
World War II.
EXECUTIVE ORDERS, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $27.95.) Vice President Jack
Ryan has problems after the deaths of the President and most of the Cabinet,
February 9, 1997
Non-Fiction
A REPORTER'S LIFE, by Walter Cronkite. (Knopf, $26.95.) From Kansas City
newsboy to newspaper reporter to television anchorman: a memoir.
ANGELA'S ASHES, by Frank McCourt. (Scribner, $24.) An Irish-American writer
recalls his childhood amid the miseries of Limerick.
CONVERSATIONS WITH GOD, by Neale Donald Walsch. (Putnam, $19.95.) The
author addresses questions of life and love, good and evil, guilt and sin.
THE MILLIONAIRE NEXT DOOR, by Thomas J. Stanley and William D. Danko.
(Longstreet, $22.) An analysis of the lives of wealthy Americans discloses that
they have seven characteristics in common.
MY SERGEI, by Ekaterina Gordeeva with E. M. Swift. (Warner, $18.95.) A memoir
of the Russian ice skater Sergei Grinkov by his longtime partner and wife.
THE GIFT OF PEACE, by Joseph Cardinal Bernardin. (Loyola Press, $17.95.)
Reflections on the last three years of his life by the late Archbishop of Chicago.
THE SOUL'S CODE, by James Hillman. (Random House, $23.) A psychologist
analyzes the elements that make up each person's essence.
THE DILBERT PRINCIPLE, by Scott Adams. (Harper Business, $22.) A satirical
look, in words and cartoons, at the current foibles of business and management.
LIVING FAITH, by Jimmy Carter. (Times Books/Random House, $23.) The former
President looks back at his life through the lens of his religious beliefs.
DOGBERT'S TOP SECRET MANAGEMENT HANDBOOK, by Scott Adams.
(Harper Business, $16.) More observations on the foibles of the business world,
reported in words and cartoons.
FOREVER, ERMA, by Erma Bombeck. (Andrews & McMeel, $22.95.) More than
190 pieces written over 31 years by the syndicated columnist, who died last year.
BEHIND THE OVAL OFFICE, by Dick Morris. (Random House, $25.95.) President
Clinton's former chief political strategist reports on the 1996 campaign.
I'M NOT REALLY HERE, by Tim Allen. (Hyperion, $21.95.) Discussions of the
irritations and delights of middle-aged men by the star of ''Home Improvement.‚Äù
MIDNIGHT IN THE GARDEN OF GOOD AND EVIL, by John Berendt. (Random
House, $23.) The mysterious death of a young man in Savannah, Ga.
DOWN IN THE GARDEN, by Anne Geddes. (Cedco, $49.95.) A collection of
photographs of infants dressed up as flora and fauna, with brief comments.
